title: Rhythmetron: with the Dance Theatre of Harlem and Arthur Mitchell
creator_credit: Milton A. Fruchtman and Capital Cities
brief_description: Arthur Mitchell, a leading black dancer, talks about the founding of the Dance Theatre of Harlem in 1970. He speaks of his own struggle for recognition in the white world of ballet. The Company dances parts of three ballets: ‘Fete Noire’, ‘Biosfera’ and ‘Rhythmetron’. Choreography by Arthur Mitchell.
